My latest in @ verge : https://www.

theverge.com/2020/3/26/2119 5760/fcc-internet-connection-social-distancing-gigi-sohn-coronavirus … # NetNeutrality 11:53 AM - 26 Mar 2020 31 42 11 replies 31 retweets 42 likes 11 31 31 42 42 Katie McAuliffe ‏ @ DigitalLiberty Mar 26 Copy link to Tweet Replying to @ gigibsohn @ FCC @ verge If the # covid Crisis is teaching us anything.

Its that we didn’t need # netneutrality rules or the heavy hand of government, nothing’s blocked, & providers are stepping up everywhere - opening # WiFi hotspots, lifting # datacaps , & not disconnecting service.
# KeepAmericansConnected 0 replies 5 retweets 16 likes 5 5 16 16 Thanks.

New conversation 🌐 ‏ @ BerinSzoka Mar 26 Copy link to Tweet Replying to @ gigibsohn @ FCC @ verge Gigi, as you know first-hand, in 2015, the FCC reclassified only "mass-market retail" broadband, excluding Internet access service sold to business or gov't customers The 2017 RIFO reversed only that decision, so didn't affect doctor's offices, hospitals, fire stations etc 2 replies 3 retweets 10 likes 2 3 3 10 10 🌐 ‏ @ BerinSzoka Mar 26 Copy link to Tweet Replying to @ BerinSzoka @ gigibsohn and 2 others I overstated what the 2015 order said: "mass-market retail" included small biz/agencies (eg doctor's offices & at least some fire departments) but NOT larger enterprises that negotiate "customized or individually negotiated arrangements" (big agencies, utilities, hospitals) pic.twitter.com/l4Xy93knNb 1 reply 0 retweets 0 likes 1 8 more replies Back to top ↑ Loading seems to be taking a while.
